abstract: The move would support one of the world’s hardest-hit markets from the credit crisis, as the country suffered fresh blows from plunging commodity prices.
snippet: The move would support one of the world’s hardest-hit markets from the credit crisis, as the country suffered fresh blows from plunging commodity prices.
lead_paragraph: MOSCOW  Prime Minister Vladimir Putin said Friday that his government would start spending billions next week to buy shares on the Russian stock exchange to support one of the world’s hardest-hit markets from the credit crisis, as the country suffered fresh blows from plunging commodity prices.

headline.main: Russia to Spend Billions Buying Shares on Stock Exchanges to Bolster Confidence
headline.print_headline: Russia to Spend Billions Buying Shares on Stock Exchanges to Bolster Confidence
